papers.title: Cryptanalysis of Compact-LWE
papers.authors: Jonathan Bootle, Mehdi Tibouchi, Keita Xagawa
papers.abstract: In the emerging Internet of Things (IoT), lightweight public key cryptography plays an essential role in security and privacy protection. With the approach of quantum computing era, it is important to design and evaluate lightweight quantum-resistant cryptographic algorithms applicable to IoT. LWE-based cryptography is a widely used and well-studied family of postquantum cryptographic constructions whose hardness is based on worst-case lattice problems. To make LWE friendly to resource-constrained IoT devices, a variant of LWE, named Compact-LWE, was proposed and used to design lightweight cryptographic schemes. In this paper, we study the so-called Compact-LWE problem and clarify that under certain parameter settings it can be solved in polynomial time. As a consequence, our result leads to a practical attack against an instantiated scheme based on Compact-LWE proposed by Liu et al. in 2017.
papers.abstract_zh: 在新兴的物联网中，轻量级公钥密码在安全和隐私保护方面起着至关重要的作用。随着量子计算时代的到来，设计和评估适用于物联网的轻量级抗量子密码算法具有重要意义。基于LWE的密码学是一个被广泛使用和研究的后量子密码构造家族，其硬度基于最坏情况的晶格问题。为了使LWE对资源受限的物联网设备友好，LWE的一个变种，名为紧凑LWE，被提出并用于设计轻量级密码方案。本文研究了所谓的紧LWE问题，阐明了在一定的参数设置下，它可以在多项式时间内求解。因此，我们的结果导致对刘等人在2017年提出的基于紧致的实例化方案的实际攻击。
